oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Barnard, George N. (1819-1902)
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville from Mabry's house, looking towards the southwest, March, 1864
View from Mabry-Hazen House, Knoxville, TN
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Panoramic view of a river and distant road with a barn and farmhouse in the center of the image and single figure at the far right.

Railroad industrialist Joseph Alexander Mabry's (1826-1882), home, built in 1858 prominently on a hilltop in Knoxville, TN, was an ideal site for photographer George Barnard to record the area's terrain. In 1864, Barnard had been named the official photographer of General William Tecumseh Sherman's Military Command. He photographed this view on March 21, 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Forts & Fortifications; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military Facilities
Visualizing the War
